channel.title: Genomics on Data science in genomics & related things
channel.description: Recent content in Genomics on Data science in genomics & related things

item.title: A primer to Data Science in Genomics
item.description: I decided to write up a few things that I learned about analysing genomic1 data. There are plenty of reasons to finally tackle this. A selfish one: becoming better at expressing myself and tidying the mess in my head. Another one: enabling others to analyse their own genomic data. The time might never come where companies have access to our most precious information. But when it does we better know how to analyse genomic data ourselves.

item.title: Data Sources for human genomics
item.description: In principle, there are five sources for genomic data: Local study cohorts (UK Biobank, Health and Retirement Study, CoLaus, Cebu Longitudinal Health and Nutrition Survey and many many more, check STable1) > A + B Summary statistics from study cohorts (GWAS catalog, UKBB neale lab, MRbase, local summary stats: GIANT, Psychiatric Genomics Consortium (PGC)) > C Genetic reference panels (1KG, Human Genetic Diversity Project (HGDP), UK10K, POPRES) > mainly A (+B) People like yourself uploading the data to platforms (openSNP) > A + B Your own data (23andme, Family Tree, Ancestry.
